instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-2936: What is 820-2936? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.PP3V3_S0: What is PP3V3_S0? The "PP3V3_S0" rail in a MacBook logic board is a power rail that supplies 3.3 volts to the system when it is fully awake (S0 state). .

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2936</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-B Missing <SIGNAL>PP3V3_S0</SIGNAL> Quater fan spin
threads.message:
Hi guys,

we're working on a <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2936</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-B logic board that came in it has green light on the charger with quarter fan spin. Replaced <CHIP>U7400</CHIP>, ISL 6259, <CHIP>U2800</CHIP>, <CHIP>U7200</CHIP>, <SIGNAL>PP3V3_S0</SIGNAL> has no shorts to ground and everything checks out okay. i replaced <TRANSISTOR>Q7830</TRANSISTOR>, <RESISTOR>R7830</RESISTOR>, <RESISTOR>R7832</RESISTOR>, <CAPACITOR>C7830</CAPACITOR>, <CAPACITOR>C7831</CAPACITOR>,i jumped <TRANSISTOR>Q7812</TRANSISTOR> pin 3 and 4 to ground and received the same results. I am a bit confused on understanding on how this circuit works. when i removed <TRANSISTOR>Q7830</TRANSISTOR> the fan spins and the board does not turn on, but i know it needs <SIGNAL>PP3V3_S0</SIGNAL> to power most of the board. Any help would be highly appreciated. Really confused.[IMG]http://advancedreworks.com/forum/images/smilies/duh.gif[/IMG][IMG]http://advancedreworks.com/forum/images/smilies/duh.gif[/IMG]

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2936</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-B Missing <SIGNAL>PP3V3_S0</SIGNAL> Quater fan spin
threads.message: By removing <TRANSISTOR>Q7830</TRANSISTOR> you are killing S0 power good signal and the board stays on. I bet all power is OK and it is a bad clock chip or SPI problem.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2936</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-B Missing <SIGNAL>PP3V3_S0</SIGNAL> Quater fan spin
threads.message: Hey duke, i replaced clock chip already and problem was the same. If it's an spi issue, should i replace it or just reflash it?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2936</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-B Missing <SIGNAL>PP3V3_S0</SIGNAL> Quater fan spin
threads.message: Depends on the history of the board, liquid? Dropped? Fucked up? Just swap a BIOS from a scrap board on there, verify it is not blank of course. Always keep the old!

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2936</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-B Missing <SIGNAL>PP3V3_S0</SIGNAL> Quater fan spin
threads.message: no liquid seems fine. i will swap a bios from another board and try it out.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2936</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-B Missing <SIGNAL>PP3V3_S0</SIGNAL> Quater fan spin
threads.message: Hi duke i swapped another bios out same problem still has quater fan spin.
